body.p:
Novr 25th 1865
His Excellency
Andrew Johnson
President of the United States
Sir,
I had the honor to be released from prison in July last by your special order on taking the oath of allegiance
I now apply to you for the pardon, required to reinvest with full rights of citizenship.

I am excluded from the amnesty only by the fact of having left a loyal state, -- Kentucky -- to join the Confederate army. I have not $20.000, have never held a civil office, did not leave the United States service, was only a Colonel in the Confederate army and Know of no clause except the above stated to exclude me from the amnesty. I was an aid-de-camp of Prest Davis and captured with him, as you were aware before granting my release.

I am not unmindful of the obligations, I have incurred in renewing my oath of allegiance to the United States, I
I may refer to the Hon Attorney General, as to the value to he attached to my word.
With grateful acknowledgement for my release,

I have the honor to be
Verry Respectfully
Yr obt Svt.
Wm Preston Johnston of Louisville, Kentucky

Executive
Feb 5th 18656.
Case of Johnston Wm P.
Louisville Ky.
Rebel
Applied for Pardon.
(1 Encl)
Respectfully referred to the Honorable the Attorney General.
By order of the President:
Wm G Moore,
A. A. G. Secretary.
Report:
Refer to Govr of Kentucky.
E M. L R. 389.
